column1: Consideration of the Grounds of Appeal
As the grounds of appeal pursued by the learned Counsel are interrelated, they
will be considered together for the purposes of the appeal.
It needs to be mentioned that in a criminal action, be it before a jury or not, the
weaknesses in the defence put forward by an accused should not be a reason
to conclude that the prosecution has been proved, and proving the case against
an accused beyond reasonable doubt always remains with the prosecution.
